intro: Wahlenbergia planiflora subsp. planiflora, commonly known as the flat-flowered bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is often found in open habitats such as heathlands and coastal dunes.
